title: Reflective Learning-Based Science Instructional Design Problem-Solving Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational instructional design theories and science curriculum content
context.additional_context: Asynchronous online science education design course where students solve actual instructional design tasks while engaging in reflective learning activities

learning_goals: Learners can systematically analyze and optimize science instructional design tasks through a three-stage reflective learning process.
Learners can evaluate their design process and derive improvement strategies by writing scaffolding-based reflective journals.
Learners can enhance the creativity, completeness, and sophistication of instructional design outputs by utilizing peer feedback and structured instructor guidance.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
